column1: Michurinsk (Russian: Мичу́ринск) is the second most populous town in Tambov Oblast

column2: it was founded in 1635 at the northern end of the emerging Belgorod Line
column3: a frontier defense line.   A 25-kilometer (16 mi) earthen wall was built eastward across the open steppe effectively blocking the Nogai Trail
column4: a Tatar raiding route. The success of this line led to the building of further lines further south. The settlement was granted town status in 1779.The town was renamed Michurinsk in 1932 after the biologist Ivan Michurin
column5: who had developed a genetic laboratory and agricultural testing fields in the Tambov region
column6: dedicated to pomology (the study of fruit growing) and selection.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Michurinsk serves as the administrative center of Michurinsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of oblast significance of Michurinsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of oblast significance of Michurinsk is incorporated as Michurinsk Urban Okrug.
